lines.content: * Represents the add command, has static methods that are called to add a new task to task list.
* Checks whether the task can be added successfully to the task list and does so if so.
* @param input The full entered by the user.
* Adds a task to the task list
* @param taskToAdd The task to add to the task list
* Represents the delete command, static method is called to delete task from task list.
* Checks whether the task can be deleted from the task list successfully and does so if so.
* @param input The full input entered by the user.
* Represents the done command, static method is called to mark a task as done in the task list.
* Checks whether the task index is valid, marks the task as done if so.
* @param input The full input the user has entered.
* Represents the find command, static method is called to find tasks that match the keyword.
* Finds the matching tasks in the task list, and calls on Printer to print them.
* If no matching tasks are found, call on Printer to print message indicating so.
* @param input The full input the user has entered.
* Represents a class containing all the constants used by other classes.
* Represents the main class, which is the entry point of the program.
* Represents a custom checked exception that occurs when the description of the command is empty.
"The description of a " + command + " cannot be empty!\n" +
* Represents a custom checked exception that occurs when the command is invalid due to invalid description.
"The description of a " + command + " must be in the form 'deadline /by time'\n" +
"The description of a " + command + " must be in the form 'event /at time!\n" +
* Represents a custom checked exception that occurs when the command that was input is unknown.
"I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means. :(\n" +
* Represents a class that parses the input by the user so that a command can be performed.
* Runs the command parser indefinitely, calls on other classes to perform the
* command, ends when the command is bye.
* @param scanner The Scanner object to be used for all user input.
* Represents a class that parses user input to a valid DeadLine object.
* Parses the user input to return a valid DeadLine object.
* @param input The full input entered by the user.
* @return A Deadline object parsed from the user input.
* @throws EmptyCommandException If the description of the deadline is empty.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If the format of the deadline is invalid.
public static Deadline processDeadline(String input) throws EmptyCommandException, InvalidCommandException {
* Represents a class that parses user input to a valid Event object.
* Parses the user input to return a valid Event Object.
* @param input The full input the user has entered.
* @return A Event Object parsed from the user input.
* @throws EmptyCommandException If the description of the event is empty.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If the description of the event is invalid.
public static Event processEvent(String input) throws EmptyCommandException, InvalidCommandException {
* Represents a class that parses the input to get a Task subclass.
* Processes the input, and calls the relevant parser to return the relevant Task subclass Object.
* @param input The full input entered by the user.
* @return Task subclass Object, either DeadLine, Event or ToDo.
* @throws UnknownCommandException If the input does not contain the string corresponding to any of the tasks.
public static Task processTaskToAdd(String input) throws UnknownCommandException {
* Represents a class that parses the input to a valid ToDo object.
* Parses the user input to return a valid ToDo object.
* @param input The full input entered by the user.
* @return A ToDo object parsed from the user input.
* @throws EmptyCommandException If the description of the ToDo is empty.
public static ToDo processToDo(String input) throws EmptyCommandException {
* Represents a class that reads in the data storage text file and loads it if it exists and has existing data.
private static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Reads the data in the text file and creates tasks to add to the task list if data is present.
* Reads the input from the text file and creates a Task subclass to add to the task list.
* @param input A line of input read from the text file.
* Reads the input from the text file and creates a Event to add to the task list
* with corresponding description and done status.
* @param input A line of input read from the text file.
private static void createEvent(boolean isDone, String description, String at) {
* Reads the input from the text file and creates a DeadLine to add to the task list
* with corresponding description and done status.
* @param input A line of input read from the text file.
private static void createDeadline(boolean isDone, String description, String by) {
* Reads the input from the text file and creates a ToDo to add to the task list
* with corresponding description and done status.
* @param input A line of input read from the text file.
private static void createToDo(boolean isDone, String description) {
* Returns the task list loaded from reading the file.
* If no file exists, the task list returned is empty.
* @return The task list loaded from reading the file.
* Represents a class that writes to the data storage text file.
* Writes the tasks in the task list to the storage text file.
* Returns a writable String based on the Task subclass identified based
* so that it can be written to the storage text file.
* @param task The Task subclass to be identified.
* on the provided task identified as a ToDo.
* so that it can be written to the storage text file.
* on the provided task identified as a DeadLine.
* so that it can be written to the storage text file.
writable = String.join(" | ", type, isDone, description, by);
* on the provided task identified as a Event.
* so that it can be written to the storage text file.
writable = String.join(" | ", type, isDone, description, at);
* Represents a DeadLine that contains a description, and a date or time to complete it by.
* Returns the date or time to complete the DeadLine by.
* @return The date or time to complete the DeadLine by.
* Represents a Event that contains a description, and the date or time it is conducted at.
* Returns the date or time the Event is conducted at.
* @return The date or time the Event is conducted at.
* Represents a Task in the task list.
* Returns the status icon of the task based on its done status.
* @return The status icon of the task based on its done status.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the done status of the task.
* @return The done status of the task.
* Represents a class containing the task list and the number of tasks in the list.
private static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Represents a ToDo that contains a description.
* Represents a class that handles the printing of output to the console.
* Prints the message when Duke is started up.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the exit message when the bye command is issued and Duke is exiting.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the tasks in the task list.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints a message to tell the user the task has been added successfully to the task list.
* @param taskToAdd The task that to be added.
* @param taskCount The number of tasks in the task list.
public static void addTaskSuccessfulMessage(Task taskToAdd, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message to tell the user the task has been marked as done successfully in the task list.
* @param taskToMarkDone The task to be marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints a message to tell the user the task has been deleted successfully from the task list.
* @param taskToDelete The task to be deleted from the task list.
* @param taskCount The number of tasks in the task list.
public static void deleteTaskSuccessfulMessage(Task taskToDelete, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message to tell the user the index they have entered is out of bounds of the task list size.
System.out.println("The index you entered is out of bounds, please enter a valid index.");
* Prints a message to tell the user that the find command must contain a keyword.
System.out.println("Keyword for find command cannot be empty");
* Prints a message to tell the user that no matching tasks with the given keyword are found in the task list.
* @param keyword The keyword to be matched.
System.out.println("No tasks matching with " + keyword + " was found in your task list.");
* Prints the matching tasks in the task list that match the keyword.
* @param matchingTasks A list containing the tasks in the task list that match with they keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Invalid format! Format the delete command like this \"delete [index]\"");
System.out.println("Invalid format! Format the done command like this \"done [index]\"");
